jiggled.definition: shook or moved quickly back and forth

unpainted.definition: not covered with paint; plain wood

screeched.definition: made a loud, high, piercing sound

orchard.definition: a place where fruit trees are grown

approvingly.definition: in a way that shows you think something is good

fastening.definition: attaching or securing something in place

hesitated.definition: paused because you're not sure what to do

urged.definition: tried hard to get someone to do something

clamor.definition: loud noise, usually from many voices or sounds

scurried.definition: moved quickly with short, hurried steps

scanned.definition: looked over an area carefully and quickly

motioned.definition: made a movement with your hand to show something

unrolled.definition: opened something that was rolled up

greeting.definition: a way of saying hello or welcoming someone

diphtheria.definition: a serious contagious disease that was common long ago

Port Madison Reservation.definition: a specific place set aside for Native American people to live

Suquamish.definition: a Native American tribe from the Pacific Northwest

agent.definition: a government official who managed a reservation

superintendent.definition: the person in charge of managing Indian agencies

Indian agency.definition: a government office that controlled reservation matters

Tulalip.definition: a specific place where the Indian agency office was located

Tribe.definition: refers to a specific Native American group

cradleboard.definition: a traditional Native American baby carrier made of wood and cloth

cattail mat.definition: a woven mat made from cattail plants, used by Native peoples

Puget Sound.definition: a large body of water in Washington State

steamer.definition: a boat powered by steam engines (historical transportation)

paested.definition: a term used by Native Americans to refer to white Americans from the eastern United States

lumber camp.definition: a place where men lived while cutting down trees for wood

paddled.definition: moved a boat through water using a paddle

evenly.definition: in a smooth and steady way

surely.definition: in a confident and certain way

regular.definition: happening often in the same way

chores.definition: small jobs that need to be done around the house

wrinkled.definition: having lines and folds in the skin

comforted.definition: made someone feel better when they were sad or worried

reservation.definition: land set aside by the government for Native American tribes to live on

underbrush.definition: small plants and bushes growing under large trees

carved.definition: cut or shaped from something larger

tideline.definition: the place on a beach where the water reaches at high tide

trimmed.definition: cut to make neat or the right size

crosspieces.definition: pieces that go across other pieces

shelter.definition: a place that protects from weather

mattress.definition: a soft pad for sleeping on

innards.definition: the inside parts of an animal

crumbly.definition: breaking apart easily into small pieces

canoe.definition: a narrow boat moved with a paddle

fishing camp.definition: a temporary place where people stay to catch fish

coho salmon.definition: a type of fish that lives in the Pacific Ocean

cattail mats.definition: woven coverings made from tall water plants

hatchet.definition: a small ax used for cutting wood

cedar.definition: a type of evergreen tree with reddish wood

fish trap.definition: a device made of sticks to catch fish

Twana.definition: a Native American tribe from Washington State

cash register.definition: a machine in a store that holds money and records sales

lodged.definition: stuck or trapped in a place

squatting.definition: crouching down close to the ground

tickled.definition: lightly touched in a way that makes you want to laugh

twinkle.definition: a playful, happy look in the eyes

confidently.definition: feeling sure you can do something

accused.definition: blamed someone for doing something wrong

disappeared.definition: went away or could not be found anymore

assigned.definition: given or set aside for someone

allotments.definition: pieces of land given to each family

swishing.definition: moving something through water with a soft sound

finality.definition: in a way that means something is decided and won't change

dread.definition: a strong feeling of fear about something that might happen

sympathetically.definition: in a caring and understanding way

skimmed.definition: moved lightly and quickly across the surface

harvested.definition: gathered crops or fish that are ready

murmured.definition: spoke in a soft, quiet voice

gazed.definition: looked at something for a long time

discouraged.definition: feeling hopeless or without energy to try

prickled.definition: felt a tingling sensation on the skin

respectfully.definition: in a polite and honoring way

snuggled.definition: cuddled up close in a comfortable way

flour-sack.definition: a bag made from the cloth used to hold flour

drying rack.definition: a frame to hang fish on so they dry in the sun

cedar bough.definition: a branch from a cedar tree

inlet.definition: a narrow strip of water that goes into the land from a larger body of water

marsh.definition: wet, soft land where water plants grow

cattails.definition: tall plants with long leaves that grow in wet areas

cattail roots.definition: the underground parts of cattail plants that can be eaten

matting.definition: woven material used for covering floors or walls

sail pole.definition: a long stick that holds up a sail

Indian Court.definition: a court system on the reservation for handling legal matters

Treaty.definition: an official agreement between the U.S. government and Native American tribes

War Department.definition: the part of the U.S. government in charge of the military (now called Department of Defense)

Skokomish Reservation.definition: land set aside for the Twana people in Washington State

Old Man House.definition: a large traditional longhouse where many families lived together

kerosene lamp.definition: a lamp that burns kerosene oil for light
